alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Dickens; King; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 28 at 10:55PM CDT until May 29 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT MONDAY FOR SOUTHWESTERN COTTLE, NORTHEASTERN DICKENS, NORTHWESTERN KING AND MOTLEY COUNTIES... At 1055 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain resulting in water over Highway 70 near Whiteflat and Highway 62 in Matador. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Matador, Dumont, Afton, Delwin and Roaring Springs. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
